meanings.definition: To remove polish or shine from (verb)
meanings.sent1: She carefully depolishes the silverware to make it look dull.
meanings.sent2: After playing outside, the rain depolishes the car, leaving it dirty.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy depolishes the freshly waxed floor with its muddy paws.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds depolish the glossy leaves, leaving them dull and lifeless.
meanings.sent5: Using the wrong cleaning product can accidentally depolish your favorite vase.

meanings.definition: The act of removing polish or shine (noun)
meanings.sent1: The depolish of the antique mirror revealed its true age and history.
meanings.sent2: The depolish of the shoes made them look worn out and old.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved a sudden depolish of the shiny coin, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: The depolish of the gemstone made it lose its sparkle and brilliance.
meanings.sent5: The depolish of the trophy showed all the hard work and dedication put into achieving it.
